Reuters reports that US special forces have landed in the Venezuelan capital of Caracas
Large secondary detonations are seen in the vicinity of Higuerote Airport, Venezuela.
The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration has issued a NOTAM banning all U.S. aircraft from operating in Venezuelan airspace, effective immediately.
Civilians have begun fleeing Venezuela's capital Caracas following the US airstrikes and reported special forces insertions.
A Venezuelan Army Fiat 6616 armoured personnel carrier is seen driving on the streets of Caracas, Venezuela.
Footage showing a civilian driving through the streets of Caracas, Venezuela, as the U.S. carries out airstrikes.

A U.S. Airforce KC-135R Stratotanker has turned on its transponder approximately 620 km off the coast of Venezuela. 
Presumably it is being used to refuel fighter jets carrying out airstrikes.
Footage showing a U.S. AH-64 Apache helicopter launching rockets at a target, somewhere in northern Venezuela.
Footage showing a U.S. AH-64 Apache helicopter launching rockets at a target, somewhere in northern Venezuela.
Apparently this is targeting the Fort Tiuna military base in Caracas
Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro has declared a state of emergency, calling on people to mobilise to "defeat this imperialist aggression."

Venezuela's foreign ministry has released a statement denouncing the US attacks on Venezuela, calling it an attempt at seizing their strategic resources such as oil, and undermining their political independence.
Venezuelan President Nicol√°s Maduro has ordered all national defence plans to be implemented "at the appropriate time and circumstances".
A massive fire is burning at the La Guaira port in Venezuela.
Heavy damage is seen at the La Guaria port north of Caracas in Venezuela following a series of U.S. airstrikes.

So far, the U.S. Airforce has attacked targets in at least 4 different regions of Venezuela.
- Dozens of airstrikes targeted the capital of Caracas, including the Fort Tiuna military base, and a number of ammunition depots, resulting in massive secondary detonations.
- At least 6 airstrikes targeted the La Guaria Port in the La Guaria State.
- Several airstrikes targeted the Miranda State, with most/all impacting Higuerote Aiport. 
- Multiple airstrikes targeted something in Aragua State, likely El Libertador Air Base (the Headquarters of the Venezuelan Air Force).

When Russia invades Ukraine, it's a full-scale unprovoked illegal invasion...
When the U.S. invades Venezuela, it's a justified military operation for national security purposes...
Make that make sense.

When Russia invades Ukraine, it's a full-scale unprovoked illegal invasion...  When the U.S. invades Venezuela, it's a justified military operation for national security purposes...  Make that make sense.

Liberal rules based order at its finest

A fire is seen burning at the Antenas El Volc√°n communications centre on the outskirts of Caracas, Venezuela, following U.S. airstrikes.
Coordinates: 10.41633, -66.84931
Donald Trump has released a statement claiming to have captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife.
Donald Trump has released a statement claiming to have captured Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro and his wife.
This could be what the earlier reported U.S. delta force landings in Caracas were for.
According to unconfirmed reports, Caracas International Airport is under U.S. control and ready to accept transport aircraft.
A COSTLY END TO 2025: UKRAINE RETREATS AND REFORMS AFTER YEAR OF STRATEGIC LOSSES

Zaporizhzhia Front: Russian Army Repels Ukrainian Landing In Rivnopillia, Reaches Zaliznychne
In the Kupyansk sector, the Ukrainian command is redeploying additional forces to prepare new attacks on the outskirts of the city. In the Kharkiv sector, intense fighting persists south of Vovchansk. 
In the Konstantynivka sector, there has been an increase in activity on the northern flank. The Russian army has captured most of the Maiske settlement, and assault groups are advancing within Konstantynivka itself toward a key bridge and the railway station. In the Sumy sector, Russian assault groups advanced up to 500 meters in several areas. In the Zaporizhzhia sector, after an attempted Ukrainian landing failed, units concentrated on reaching Zaliznychne and expanding the control zone near the Malokaterynivka estuary.
Czech Prime Minister Andrej Babi≈° stated that the country can no longer provide Ukraine with direct funding from the state budget.
Read more 
HERE

The Price Of A Flag Is Life: How Ukraine's Command Fakes Territory Control
In recent days, Russian forces have destroyed at least two sabotage and reconnaissance groups of the AFU sent to Myrnohrad (Dimitrov)‚Äîa city fully under Russian military control. Videos of the destroyed groups have circulated online. A common feature of these operations has been that each group was carrying Ukrainian flags with the aim of planting and filming them to create an illusion of control over the city. 
A similar tactic has been evident in the case of the 4th Brigade of the National Guard of Ukraine's personnel, who found themselves encircled in Myrnohrad. Instead of ammunition or food, the Ukrainian command dropped flags to them using drones. Captured servicemen of this brigade, taken prisoner by Russian forces, openly described the nature of the assignment: 
"They drop flags to us and force us to wave them, covering their own asses in the process."
üëâ

HERE

Blasts Rock Venezuelan Capital In What Appears To Be Opening Of U.S. War (Videos)
A series of blasts rocked different parts of the Venezuelan capital, Caracas, and its outskirts early on January 3, in what may be the opening of a military operation by the United States.
The U.S. began a pressure campaign against Venezuela all the way back in October, accusing President Nicol√°s Maduro of links to drug cartels, which were later designated as terrorist groups. In September, the campaign escalated into strikes against alleged drug trafficking boats in the Caribbean Sea and the Eastern Pacific Ocean. Around 35 boats have been hit since, with at least 115 traffickers killed.
The early morning blasts in Caracas appeared to be the result of strikes, with videos posted online showing secondary explosions. In some footage, a drone buzzing sound can be clearly heard.
Reuters reported a power outrage in certain parts of Caracas following the blasts, including in an area where a base is located.
Read more 
HERE

Maduro Mobilizes Venezuelan Army As U.S. Helicopters Attack Key HQ In Caracas (Videos)
President Nicol√°s Maduro signed a state of emergency and ordered all national defense plans to be implemented ‚Äúat the appropriate time and under the appropriate circumstances,‚Äù the Venezuelan government announced in a statement issued on January 3 morning, just a few hours after the beginning of an attack on the country by the United States.
U.S. officials confirmed to CBS News that Trump ordered strikes on sites inside Venezuela, including military facilities, without providing any additional details.
Other officials told CNN later that the U.S. Senate Armed Services Committee was not notified by the Trump administration ahead of the strikes.
Videos posted online indicate that many military sites in Caracas were hit, with evidence suggesting multiple air defense systems were destroyed and reports saying that the residency of the country‚Äôs defense minister, Vladimir Padrino L√≥pez, was targeted.
Read more 
HERE
